title.narrative: Preserve resilience of Palestine refugees from Syria in Jordan through the provision of winterization assistance

description.narrative: Through the intervention outlined in this project proposal, UNRWA in Jordan envisages to distribute winterization assistance at the end of 2020 in the form of a cash-based transfer to 1,675 PRS families (503 Female-Headed Households, 1,172 Male-Headed Households), amounting to approximately 7,306 PRS individuals (3,786 female, 3,520 male) recorded with the Agency. This will enable the Agency to partially cover (42%) its 2020 winterization needs, that normally amount to approximately USD 1,430,000 to cover the entire PRS caseload in Jordan (approx. 4,300 families). This kind of support is delivered once a year at the beginning of the winter season to support PRS families to prepare for the upcoming season. UNRWA in Jordan has provided winterization support to the entire PRS caseload in 2016, 2017 and 2018, following the same rationale used by UNHCR to provide winterization assistance to Syrian refugees in Jordan.

participating-org.narrative: United Nations Relief and Works Agency

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Preserve resilience of Palestine refugees from Syria in Jordan through the provision of winterization assistance

receiver-org.narrative: United Nations Relief and Works Agency

title.narrative: RESIDENT / HUMANITARIAN COORDINATOR REPORT ON THE USE OF CERF FUNDS JORDAN UNDERFUNDED EMERGENCIES DISPLACEMENT 2020

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: PRS are able to meet their essential life-saving needs and to cope with sudden crises
Number of PRS families provided with winterization cash assistance in quarter 4 2020
Number of PRS families stating that the cash assistance received were enough to cover basic needs for half of the winter season
